00021 #ifndef _MMALLOC_ALLOCATOR_H_
00022 #define _MMALLOC_ALLOCATOR_H_

00039 #include <mmalloc.h>

00041 #include "time_tracker.h"

00043 using namespace std;
00044 
00045 class mmalloc_wrapper {
00046 
00047 public:
00048   mmalloc_wrapper() {
00049 
00050     if(visited == false) {
00051 
00052       mmap_fd = open("xxxx000.tmp", O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0777);
00053       if (mmap_fd < 0) {
00054         cout << "Open failed" << endl;
00055         exit(1);
00056       }
00057 
00058       mmalloc_md = mmalloc_attach(mmap_fd, (void *) NULL);
00059       if (mmalloc_md == NULL) {
00060         cout << "mmalloc_attach failed!!" << endl;
00061         exit(1);
00062       }
00063    
00064       visited = true;
00065     } 
00066   }
00067 
00068   static int mmap_fd;
00069   static void* mmalloc_md;
00070   static bool visited;
00071 };
00072 bool mmalloc_wrapper::visited=false;
00073 void* mmalloc_wrapper::mmalloc_md;
00074 int mmalloc_wrapper::mmap_fd;
00075 
00076 /*
00077  * mmalloc based allocator.
00078  */
00079 template <class _Tp>
00080 class  mmalloc_allocator {
00081 public:
00082 
00083     typedef _Tp        value_type;
00084     typedef value_type *       pointer;
00085     typedef const _Tp* const_pointer;
00086     typedef _Tp&       reference;
00087     typedef const _Tp& const_reference;
00088     typedef size_t     size_type;
00089     typedef ptrdiff_t  difference_type;
00090 
00091     template <class _Tp1> struct rebind {
00092         typedef mmalloc_allocator<_Tp1> other;
00093     };
00094 
00095     mmalloc_allocator() { }
00096 
00097     template <class U> 
00098     mmalloc_allocator(mmalloc_allocator<U> const& other) { } 
00099 
00100     template <class U> 
00101     mmalloc_allocator& operator=(mmalloc_allocator<U> const& other) { 
00102       return *this; 
00103     }
00104 
00105     template <typename U>
00106     friend class mmalloc_allocator;
00107 
00108     ~mmalloc_allocator() {
00109     }
00110 
00111     pointer address(reference __x) { 
00112       return &__x; 
00113     }
00114 
00115     const_pointer address(const_reference __x) const { 
00116       return &__x; 
00117     }
00118 
00119     /*
00120     * __n is permitted to be 0.  The C++ standard says nothing about what
00121     * the return value is when __n == 0.
00122     */
00123     _Tp* allocate(size_type __n, const void* = 0) const {
00124         return __n == 0 ? NULL : (_Tp*)mmalloc(wrap.mmalloc_md, __n * sizeof(value_type));
00125     }
00126 
00127     /*
00128     *__p is permitted to be a null pointer, only if n==0.
00129     */
00130     void deallocate(pointer __p, size_type __n) const {
00131         if(__p != 0)
00132           mfree(wrap.mmalloc_md, __p);
00133     }
00134 
00135     size_type max_size() const { 
00136       return size_t(-1) / sizeof(value_type); 
00137     }
00138 
00139     void construct(pointer __p, const _Tp& __val) const { 
00140       new (__p) _Tp(__val); 
00141     }
00142 
00143     void destroy(pointer __p) const { 
00144       __p->~_Tp(); 
00145     }
00146 
00147 private:
00148     static mmalloc_wrapper wrap;
00149 };
00150 
00151 template <typename _Tp> 
00152 mmalloc_wrapper mmalloc_allocator<_Tp>::wrap;
00153 
00154 template<class _Ty,
00155 class _Other> inline
00156     bool operator==(const mmalloc_allocator<_Ty>&, const mmalloc_allocator<_Other>&) {  
00157     // test for allocator equality (always true)
00158     return (true);
00159 }
00160 
00161 template<class _Ty,
00162 class _Other> inline
00163     bool operator!=(const mmalloc_allocator<_Ty>&, const mmalloc_allocator<_Other>&) {  
00164     // test for allocator inequality (always false)
00165     return (false);
00166 }
00167 
00168 #endif
